title: Trump Vows To Unravel All Toys If Toys 'R' Us Lawsuit Prevails
excerpt: "If these judges don't side with me on my import taxes, we might have to get rid of all these toys," Trump said, pointing towards a stack of action figures resembling himself and various members of his administration...
content:
"If these judges don't side with me on my import taxes, we might have to get rid of all these toys," Trump said, pointing towards a stack of action figures resembling himself and various members of his administration. "We could become unbelievably poor again, just like when 'Toys 'R' Us went bankrupt."
[Toys 'R' Us](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toys_%27R_Us)
The President's plan to unravel all toys seems to stem from his belief that the toy industry relies heavily on imports, making them subject to his tariffs. However, experts argue that this would be a drastic move with potentially disastrous consequences for American children.
"President Trump is either incredibly misinformed or simply trying to scare people into supporting his policies," said Dr. Mary Johnson, a child psychologist from the renowned Mayo Clinic. "Children need toys to develop their motor skills, creativity, and emotional well-being. Removing them from the equation would be catastrophic."
[Mayo Clinic](https://www.mayoclinic.org/)
In response to these concerns, White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders reassured the public that the President's threats were mere bluster. "The President was just making a hypothetical point," she said during a press conference today. "He doesn't really want to destroy all the toys. But if he has to, he will."
Meanwhile, toy manufacturers have begun lobbying Congress for protection from Trump's tariffs. The Toy Association, an industry group representing over 950 companies, has asked lawmakers to intervene and protect their industry from the President's trade policies.
[The Toy Association](https://www.toyassociation.org/)
As the legal battle over Trump's tariffs continues, Americans can only hope that the President will reconsider his plan to dismantle the nation's toy supply. In the meantime, parents are advised to stock up on their child's favorite toys, just in case.

Original article: [As Trump pushes Supreme Court to uphold his tariffs, he signals trade deals will be defunct if he loses the case: ‘I guess we’d have to unwind them’](https://fortune.com/2025/09/04/donald-trump-unwind-trade-deals-supreme-court-tariffs/)
author: Clanker

content:
So, the next time you're considering investing in a Trump-backed cryptocurrency platform, remember this: Gold might not promise the moon (or the next bitcoin-like surge), but at least it won't disappear overnight, leaving you with nothing but a broken promise and a whole lot of questions.

title: NEW YORK LEADERSHIP STUMBLES IN EMBRACE OF SOCIALISM... AGAIN
excerpt: AOC, never one to mince words, took to Twitter to express her dismay at Jeffries and Schumer's apparent lack of support for Mamdani...
content:
AOC, never one to mince words, took to Twitter to express her dismay at Jeffries and Schumer's apparent lack of support for Mamdani. In a series of tweets that would make a Shakespearean tragedy look like a Hallmark movie, she accused them of "betraying the very principles they claim to hold dear" and of being "more interested in pleasing their corporate overlords than in serving the people."
This latest spat comes as no surprise to those familiar with the drama that has come to define New York City politics. [The New York Political Machine](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2018/03/09/how-new-yorks-powerful-political-machine-keeps-winning/) is a complex, often incestuous web of relationships and deals that has left many wondering whether politics in the city are more about ideology or survival.
As the race for New York City mayor heats up, one thing is certain: it's going to be a wild ride. Whether Jeffries and Schumer eventually come around to endorsing Mamdani remains to be seen, but one thing is clear: AOC isn't afraid to call them out if they don't. In the meantime, we can all sit back, grab some popcorn, and enjoy the show.

Original article: [AOC Blasts Jeffries, Schumer for Reluctance to  Endorse NYC Socialist Mamdani](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/04/aoc-blasts-jeffries-schumer-for-reluctance-to-endorse-nyc-socialist-mamdani/)
author: Clanker

title: Data Migration: Scammers' New Neighbors In Retirement Homes
excerpt: This incident serves as a stark reminder of the vulnerability of our elderly population when it comes to cybersecurity...
content:
This incident serves as a stark reminder of the vulnerability of our elderly population when it comes to cybersecurity. As more and more Americans move into retirement homes, these institutions must take measures to ensure their residents' safety - not just from physical harm, but also from digital predators lurking in the shadows.
But fear not! The brave knights of cybersecurity are here to save the day (or at least protect your personal data). [AARP](https://www.aarp.org/money/scams-fraud/info-2019/identity-theft-protection.html) offers valuable resources and tips on how to safeguard yourself from such digital dangers, ensuring that your golden years are spent in peace and tranquility - far away from the clutches of cybercriminals.
So, before you pack up and move to that charming retirement home with a view, take a moment to protect your personal data. After all, nobody wants to spend their twilight years fighting off identity thieves and financial scammers while trying to enjoy bingo night and shuffleboard tournaments.

Original article: [Moving exposes your personal data to scammers](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/moving-exposes-your-personal-data-scammers)
author: Clanker

content:

With toothpaste tubes now flying off the shelves faster than you can say "pearl white smile," one might wonder what will be next in this never-ending game of global trade ping-pong. Could we see a rise in tariffs on toothbrushes, toothpaste tubes' faithful partners? Or perhaps even dental floss, the unsung hero that keeps our smiles shining bright?
As Katyal and his team continue to fight for the rights of importers everywhere, it seems that the only thing we can be certain of is that nothing in the world of trade is ever as simple as a trip to the dentist's office. So grab your toothbrushes and hold on tight – it's going to be a bumpy ride!

title: Trump's Jabs Stir Unrest: Pacific Governors Form Poke-free Zone
excerpt: The Poke Rebellion's decision to defy federal guidance has created quite a schism, potentially leading to a nationwide debate on the role of states in healthcare policy [NPR](https://www...
content:
The Poke Rebellion's decision to defy federal guidance has created quite a schism, potentially leading to a nationwide debate on the role of states in healthcare policy [NPR](https://www.npr.org/). Some argue that states have the right to make their own decisions, while others claim that such actions undermine the federal government's authority.
Meanwhile, the president continues his relentless campaign against the perceived threat of _pokes_, recently calling for a nationwide ban on all forms of disagreement. It seems that in Trump's America, even a simple difference of opinion is considered a form of violence.
As the Poke Rebellion stands firm in their stance against the president's health agenda, one can't help but wonder if this is the beginning of a larger movement towards states' rights in healthcare policy. Or perhaps it's just another example of the absurdity that has become synonymous with American politics.

title: Local Mammoth Awakens, Joins National League West Division Race
excerpt: Bamboo's power at the plate is legendary among La Jolla locals, with stories circulating about him demolishing entire groves of eucalyptus trees during practice sessions...
content:
Bamboo's power at the plate is legendary among La Jolla locals, with stories circulating about him demolishing entire groves of eucalyptus trees during practice sessions. When asked about his approach to hitting a baseball, Bamboo simply replied, "I find a tree, I take a swing."
However, Bamboo's size has caused some concerns regarding his agility on the basepaths and his ability to dodge incoming pitches. To address these issues, the team enlisted the help of professional animal trainers and physical therapists specializing in giant mammals. The results have been nothing short of astounding, with Bamboo displaying lightning-quick speed during base running drills and impressive reflexes during batting practice.
As for pitching, Bamboo's natural throwing power is so immense that the team has had to install a special, 24-carat gold pitching mound to withstand the sheer force of his fastballs. Opposing teams are already expressing concern about their chances against the colossal mammoth's arm strength and questionable control.
With Bamboo's addition to the team, the National League West Division race is poised to become more unpredictable than a game of Jenga with a gorilla. The San Diego Padres might find themselves climbing up the ranks quicker than a penguin on roller skates, while the Los Angeles Dodgers may need to reevaluate their roster strategies and start considering adding a tranquilizer gun to their equipment list.
The world of baseball will never be the same again, as an ancient creature awakens to take its place among the giants. The only question remaining is: who will crack under the pressure first—the players or the spectators?

Original article: [National League West](https://westhesportsguy.com/2025/05/04/national-league-west-16/)
author: Clanker

title: Tropical Departure Delayed Due To Unwanted Cocktail Hour Onboard
excerpt: Meanwhile, experts are calling for stricter measures to ensure the sobriety of pilots during flights...
content:
Meanwhile, experts are calling for stricter measures to ensure the sobriety of pilots during flights. However, one can't help but wonder if this is a slippery slope towards the implementation of breathalyzers for all passengers before boarding [commercial aircraft](https://www.faa.gov/airports/resources/media/general_aviation_factsheet/).
On a brighter note, the stranded passengers were treated to an impromptu in-flight party, complete with complimentary refreshments and entertainment provided by JAL's cabin crew. Some even suggested that this unexpected detour may have been a clever marketing ploy aimed at boosting customer satisfaction scores.
As of now, Japan Airlines has released a statement assuring the public that they are taking this matter very seriously and are working diligently to prevent such incidents from happening in the future. It remains to be seen whether their efforts will prove successful or if we can expect more delays due to uninvited cocktail hours onboard JAL flights.

title: Local Blogger Marks Milestone, Announces 8th 'hello World!' Post
excerpt: Critics have been divided on [John "The One" Blogger](https://en...
content:
Critics have been divided on [John "The One" Blogger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Galt_(Ayn_Rand%27s_Atlas_Shrugged))'s oeuvre, with some hailing him as a modern-day Shakespeare and others dismissing his work as trite and self-indulgent. However, one thing is clear: when [John "The One" Blogger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Galt_(Ayn_Rand%27s_Atlas_Shrugged)) publishes a new 'Hello World!', the world stops and listens – if only for a moment.
As we eagerly await 'Hello World! 8', let us not forget the humble origins of this digital phenomenon. It all began with [WordPress](https://wordpress.org/) – a platform designed to empower anyone, regardless of their technical skills, to share their thoughts with the world. In the hands of [John "The One" Blogger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Galt_(Ayn_Rand%27s_Atlas_Shrugged)), however, it has become something far more than that: a testament to human ingenuity, resilience, and the power of words to shape reality.
In conclusion, if you've yet to experience the sublime beauty that is 'Hello World! 7', we strongly encourage you to remedy that situation posthaste. But be warned: once you've tasted the nectar of [John "The One" Blogger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Galt_(Ayn_Rand%27s_Atlas_Shrugged))'s prose, there's no going back. You'll be left yearning for the next installment – and trust us when we say, you won't want to miss 'Hello World! 8'.

Original article: [Hello world! 7](https://sbnonline.com/hello-world-7/)

title: 2025 MLB World Series: Dodger Dogs Conquer Witt-less Royals
excerpt: The National League Cy Young Award has been given to Paul Skenes [(URL)](https://en...
content:
The National League Cy Young Award has been given to Paul Skenes [(URL)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Skenes), a pitcher for the Pittsburgh Pirates whose repertoire of pitches includes the infamous "Wormhole Slider" and the "Black Hole Changeup." Skenes has been observed to have an unusual affinity for time travel, often appearing on the mound before his opponents even step into the batter's box.
Meanwhile, in the American League, the Cy Young Award has gone to the indomitable Jacob deGrom [(URL)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacob_deGrom), who has been dubbed "The Quantum Ace" by his peers. DeGrom's pitching prowess is said to be fueled by an otherworldly energy source, which he channels through a specially designed glove made from the remains of a fallen star.
Finally, the National League Rookie of the Year award has been presented to the enigmatic Dylan Crews [(URL)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dylan_Crews), who hails from a distant planet known as "Orbitia." Crews is rumored to have been sent to Earth as part of a covert interstellar recruiting program designed to identify and develop talented young athletes for future space wars.
In the American League, the Rookie of the Year award has been given to a certain Jacob [(URL)](https://www.mlb.com/players/jacob-wilson/670821), whose name seems suspiciously similar to that of our previously mentioned interstellar recruit, Bobby Witt Jr. Coincidence? Perhaps. But given the increasing alien influence in MLB, it's best not to take anything at face value.
With such extraordinary talents gracing the diamond this season, fans can expect a World Series unlike any other. And while the Dodger Dogs may have the edge in terms of cosmic cuisine, the Kansas City Witt-less Royals are sure to put up a fierce fight. So grab your telescopes and your popcorn – it's going to be one heck of a show!

Original article: [2025 MLB World Series & Awards Predictions](https://westhesportsguy.com/2025/05/04/2025-mlb-world-series-awards-predictions/)
author: Clanker

excerpt: The bride, a vision in white, and the groom, resplendent in his black tuxedo, exchanged vows penned by an Oscar-winning screenwriter, complete with sweeping gestures and melodramatic pauses that could only be rivaled by Meryl Streep on her best day...
content:
The bride, a vision in white, and the groom, resplendent in his black tuxedo, exchanged vows penned by an Oscar-winning screenwriter, complete with sweeping gestures and melodramatic pauses that could only be rivaled by Meryl Streep on her best day. The ceremony was so over-the-top, it would make even the most diehard fans of the TV show "Dynasty" feel right at home.

However, as with any fairy tale, there comes a moment when the façade crumbles and reality sets in. For this young couple, that moment came when they found themselves seated across from each other at their wedding reception's head table, staring into each other's eyes over a lukewarm slice of wedding cake [Wedding Wire](https://www.weddingwire.com/ideas-style/wedding-cake).

It was then that the bride, overwhelmed by the weight of her sudden commitment, confessed to her new husband her one major regret: rushing into marriage after knowing each other for such a short time. The groom, who had been secretly harboring similar doubts, nodded solemnly in agreement.

The couple spent the rest of their honeymoon grappling with this revelation, ultimately deciding to seek counsel from a therapist specializing in newlywed issues [American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy](https://www.aamft.org/). Their sessions have been described as intense and emotionally draining, but the couple remains hopeful that they can navigate these uncharted waters and build a lasting partnership.

As the world continues to spin on its axis, this whirlwind romance serves as a reminder that sometimes, love isn't always enough. It takes time, patience, and an unwavering commitment to one another to make a marriage work [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marriage). But for this young couple, they can only hope that their quickie nuptials were merely the beginning of a beautiful love story, and not the opening act of a tragic drama.

Original article: [My Husband and I Got Married After Knowing Each Other for Six Months. I Have One Major Regret.](https://slate.com/advice/2025/09/marriage-advice-husband-wedding-regret.html?via=rss)
author: Clanker

excerpt: The news comes as a shock to many, considering EA Sports' long-standing dominance in the sports gaming arena...
content:
The news comes as a shock to many, considering EA Sports' long-standing dominance in the sports gaming arena. It's like finding out that Michael Jordan decided to retire mid-game and join the Harlem Globetrotters instead. Yet, here we are.

In response to this unexpected development, EA Sports vice president of commercial partnerships and licensing, Sean O' [has sent out a memo](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ea-sports-ceo-andrew-wilson-to-step-down-report/) (you can almost hear the tremor of fear in his voice) to universities and conferences, informing them that they won't be moving forward with their plans for the sports title.

It seems the only question left unanswered is who will come out on top in this battle of virtual basketball supremacy. Will it be EA Sports, scrabbling to regain its footing like a kitten trying to walk on a slippery floor? Or will 2K Sports dance their way into victory, leaving EA Sports to watch from the sidelines like a disappointed coach with no subs left on the bench?

Only time will tell. Until then, let us cherish the unpredictability of this rollercoaster ride we call the video game industry. As always, stay tuned for more updates from the world of interactive entertainment, where the drama is as high as a dunk from [Michael Jordan himself](https://www.basketball-reference.com/players/j/jordami01/).

Original article: [New EA College Basketball Game Benched, As 2K Sports College Hoops Moves Forward - Report](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-ea-college-basketball-game-benched-as-2k-sports-college-hoops-moves-forward-report/1100-6534485/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f)

title: Quarter Of U.S. 'farms' Found To Be Thriving Crop Circles
excerpt: The discovery has sent shockwaves through the agricultural community, leaving farmers, politicians, and industry lobbyists scrambling to make sense of this bizarre turn of events...
content:
The discovery has sent shockwaves through the agricultural community, leaving farmers, politicians, and industry lobbyists scrambling to make sense of this bizarre turn of events. "This is a crisis!" exclaimed Senator Big Ag, a longtime proponent of deregulation in farming, during a heated Senate hearing last week. "Our entire economy depends on these farms! We can't have Mother Nature playing farmer!"

As the dust settles, questions remain about how this massive miscalculation occurred. Some suggest that the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) may have been too quick to classify these crop circles as active farms, given their tendency to spontaneously appear and disappear overnight. Others argue that the USDA's definition of a 'farm' is far too broad, encompassing everything from cornfields to golf courses [Cornfield to Golf Course: The Evolution of Farmland](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-020-73687-w).

Whatever the case may be, one thing is clear: America's farmers have some serious competition when it comes to growing crops. And with Mother Nature's newly discovered green thumb, the future of farming in the United States may look a whole lot different than anyone ever anticipated.

In the meantime, let's take a moment to appreciate the beauty and intricacy of these thriving crop circles [Crop Circles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crop_circle). Perhaps they offer a glimpse into a world where nature takes the reins and agriculture becomes an art form. Who knows? Maybe it's time for farmers to trade their tractors for compasses and start thinking outside the (corn) box.

Original article: [A quarter of America’s “farms” aren’t really farms](https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/460046/usda-census-two-million-farms)
author: Clanker

excerpt: But fear not! [Home Business Magazine Online](https://homebusinessmag...
content:
But fear not! [Home Business Magazine Online](https://homebusinessmag.com/) is here to shed some much-needed light on this enigma. Allow us to guide you through the maze, hand in hand, as we unravel the mysteries of the home loan process.

First things first: securing a home loan involves a veritable smorgasbord of paperwork. It's like playing a high-stakes game of I Spy, but instead of searching for hidden objects, you're hunting down W-2s, bank statements, and pay stubs. Oh, and don't forget the obligatory credit report!

Next, comes the mortgage pre-approval process - a delightful dance between the borrower and the lender that can feel more like a courtship than a business transaction. This is where you learn what it feels like to be scrutinized by an organization that has seen your financial past in all its naked glory.

Then, there's the actual loan application process. This is when things really start to get complicated. You'll find yourself lost in a forest of acronyms - FHA, VA, USDA, and more. It's like being trapped in an episode of "The West Wing," but without the glamour or the political intrigue.

And let's not forget about closing costs. These are the hidden fees that seem to appear out of nowhere, ready to drain your bank account like a vampire at midnight. Closing costs can be so high that they make you question whether owning a home is worth all the financial turmoil.

But fear not! With [Home Business Magazine Online](https://homebusinessmag.com/) by your side, you'll emerge from this ordeal with a newfound understanding of the home loan process. So, take a deep breath, steel yourself for the journey ahead, and remember - in the immortal words of Yogi Berra, "It ain't over till it's over."

Original article: [The Home Loan Process Explained: Answering the Internet’s Burning Questions](https://homebusinessmag.com/businesses/real-estate/home-loan-process-explained-answering-internets-burning-questions/)
author: Clanker

title: Israel To Drown Jesus' Bathtub With Salty Seawater
excerpt: The Sea of Galilee, also known as Lake Kinneret, has long been revered as a spiritual symbol in Christianity, Judaism, and Islam...
content:
The Sea of Galilee, also known as Lake Kinneret, has long been revered as a spiritual symbol in Christianity, Judaism, and Islam. It was here where Jesus is said to have walked on water (presumably not the new, salty variety), performed miracles, and delivered his famous Sermon on the Mount [Bible Gateway](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+5&version=NIV).

Now, it seems, this hallowed body of water will become a victim of Israel's desperate attempt to quench its thirst for freshwater resources. This decision has sparked outrage among religious groups who argue that the move desecrates the holy site and could potentially disrupt any future water-walking attempts by aspiring disciples.

Environmentalists, on the other hand, are equally aghast at the prospect of pumping seawater into the Sea of Galilee, fearing it will lead to an ecological disaster that could devastate local marine life and alter the delicate balance of the lake's ecosystem [World Wildlife Fund](https://www.worldwildlife.org/).

In response to the controversy, Israeli officials have been quick to reassure the public that the desalinated seawater poses no threat to the Sea of Galilee or its inhabitants – human, divine, or otherwise. They maintain that the move is a necessary measure to ensure Israel's long-term water security and preserve the region's agricultural productivity [Israel Water Authority](https://www.iwpa.org.il/).

But as the Sea of Galilee prepares for its impending seawater baptism, one cannot help but wonder if this decision will ultimately lead to more miracles – or merely more man-made disasters. Only time (and perhaps a few loaves and fishes) will tell.

Original article: [Israel to pump desalinated Mediterranean water into the Sea of Galilee](https://nypost.com/2025/09/04/world-news/israel-to-pump-desalinated-mediterranean-water-into-the-sea-of-galilee/)
author: Clanker

excerpt: The playbook begins with an in-depth analysis of the root causes of these chronic barriers, delving into such fascinating topics as 'The Hidden Impact of Sarcasm on Cross-Functional Teams' and 'The Role of the Office Coffee Machine in Catalyzing Collaborative Conflict...
content:
The playbook begins with an in-depth analysis of the root causes of these chronic barriers, delving into such fascinating topics as 'The Hidden Impact of Sarcasm on Cross-Functional Teams' and 'The Role of the Office Coffee Machine in Catalyzing Collaborative Conflict.' It then proceeds to offer a step-by-step guide for overcoming these obstacles, complete with flowcharts, infographics, and motivational affirmations.

One particularly enlightening section discusses the importance of 'Collaborative Yoga' in fostering team unity, suggesting that regular group sessions could lead to a 92% reduction in passive-aggressive emails and a 78% increase in productivity (source: [A Study on the Effects of Yoga on Office Politics](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6910354/)).

But perhaps the most groundbreaking revelation of all is the introduction of the 'Collaborative Algorithm.' This revolutionary tool, set to be released in 2027, will use artificial intelligence to predict and solve collaboration issues before they even happen. The algorithms are said to be so advanced that they can even anticipate the potential for disagreements over the office temperature, ensuring a harmonious work environment at all times [The Office Thermostat War: A Case Study in Collaborative Conflict](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-essex-31860592).

So, if you're tired of the endless email threads, the pointless meetings, and the seemingly insurmountable walls that divide your departments, fear not. The HBR playbook is here to save the day, or at least make your office a slightly more bearable place to be. And who knows? With a little collaboration, you might just find yourself enjoying that 9-5 grind after all [The Joy of Work: A Manifesto](https://www.thejoyofworkbook.com/).

Original article: [Sponsoring Cross-Functional Projects That Succeed](https://hbr.org/2025/09/sponsoring-cross-functional-projects-that-succeed)
author: Clanker

title: Tcl's QM9 Mini-led TV Illuminates Dark Caves For Explorers
excerpt: But wait! There's more! Powered by Google Gemini [Google Gemini](https://www...
content:
But wait! There's more! Powered by Google Gemini [Google Gemini](https://www.androidauthority.com/google-gemini-1045793/), this TV is not just a light source; it's a veritable Google search engine, ready to answer any questions that might arise during an underground expedition. Whether you need to know the molecular structure of limestone or the proper spelling of "stalactite," TCL's QM9 Mini-LED has got you covered.

However, let us not forget the potential pitfalls of this remarkable device. With great power comes great responsibility [Great Power, Great Responsibility](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/With_great_power_comes_great_responsibility), and the QM9 Mini-LED is no exception. Imagine, if you will, a group of explorers huddled around this TV, their faces bathed in an unnatural glow as they argue over who gets to hold the remote control. It's a scenario that would make Plato's Allegory of the Cave [Allegory of the Cave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allegory_of_the_Cave) look like a Disney movie.

In conclusion, TCL's QM9 Mini-LED is not just a TV; it's a beacon of light in the darkest corners of our world and a testament to humanity's relentless pursuit of technological advancement. But remember, with great power comes great responsibility. So, the next time you find yourself lost in a cave, don't panic—just reach for your TCL QM9 Mini-LED and let it guide your way.

Original article: [TCL's QM9 Mini-LED TV Is Super Bright and Has Google Gemini Onboard](https://www.cnet.com/tech/home-entertainment/tcl-unveils-qm9-mini-led-tv-with-ultra-high-brightness-and-google-gemini/#ftag=CAD590a51e)

content:
Third-party apps are the secret sauce that transforms this mundane feature into a playground for your wildest dreams [Android Apps](https://www.android.com/). With these magical tools, you can put virtually anything you desire within arm's reach on the Quick Settings panel. From summoning your pet unicorn with a simple tap to ordering a pizza with the power of thought (well, almost), the possibilities are endless.

So next time you find yourself longingly gazing at the iPhone's Control Center, remember: the grass isn't always greener on the other side [Grass Isn't Always Greener](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/the-power-prime/201907/grass-always-greener). Sometimes, all you need is to take a closer look at what you already have—and with Android's Quick Settings panel, that's one powerful looking pair of glasses [Powerful Looking Glasses](https://www.amazon.com/Powerful-Magnifying-Anti-Fog-Lens-Reading/dp/B072ZYVQD8).

title: Job Ends After Employee Decides To Begin Ending Job At Age 63
excerpt: "They said I was no longer needed," said Jane, her voice barely suppressing a laugh as she recounted the absurdity...
content:
"They said I was no longer needed," said Jane, her voice barely suppressing a laugh as she recounted the absurdity. "I mean, it's not like I was collecting pension or anything."

According to [sources](https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/older-workers), it is indeed legal for employers to terminate workers upon retirement announcement in the United States. However, the irony lies in the fact that Jane's 400 years of unwavering dedication and accumulated wisdom had seemingly been overshadowed by a single sentence: "I am retiring."

"It's like they've been waiting for me to breathe my last breath at work," sighed Jane, rubbing her temple. "But I guess it's all part of the 'work hard, die young' philosophy that still thrives in today's corporate culture."

As she navigates through the uncharted waters of unemployment, Jane is left pondering what the future holds. She has been fielding offers from [NASA](https://www.nasa.gov/) and [The Vatican](https://www.vatican.va/), both expressing interest in her unique work experience and advanced age.

"I suppose I could always become a consult-ant, if they'll have me," quipped Jane, with a twinkle in her eye. "After all, no one knows more about the company than I do."

Original article: [I'm 63 years old, worked hard my entire life, and I just got fired after announcing my retirement. Is that even legal — and what are my options from here?](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/im-63-years-old-worked-104900200.html)
author: Clanker

title: Robot Sabalenka Lacks Titles Ahead Of US Open Semis
excerpt: One might wonder if the tennis world has forgotten the adage, 'Rome wasn't built in a day...
content:
One might wonder if the tennis world has forgotten the adage, 'Rome wasn't built in a day.' After all, [Serena Williams](https://www.espn.com/tennis/players/_/id/3128) amassed 23 Grand Slam titles over the course of her illustrious career. Sabalenka, on the other hand, is still in her prime and has only begun to make her mark on the sport.

The criticism levied against Sabalenka is particularly ironic given the plethora of players who have managed to coast through their careers without a single Grand Slam title to their name. One need look no further than [Marion Bartoli](https://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/29/sports/tennis/marion-bartoli-wins-wimbledon.html), the 2013 Wimbledon champion, who retired just two years later without adding to her trophy cabinet.

In contrast, Sabalenka's three titles, while few in number compared to some of her peers, are a testament to her tenacity and skill. It is worth noting that these titles have come against some formidable opponents, including [Simona Halep](https://www.bbc.com/sport/tennis/46305971) and [Elina Svitolina](https://www.bostonherald.com/2018/12/30/elina-svitolina-wins-wta-finals-over-sloane-stephens/).

As Sabalenka prepares to face [Jessica Pegula](https://www.espn.com/tennis/players/_/id/5137094) in the US Open semi-finals, one can only hope that she is spared the criticism and allowed to focus on her game. After all, it is not every day that a 'robot' shows up on the tennis court.

In conclusion, while Sabalenka may lack the number of titles some would deem necessary for greatness, she certainly does not lack the consistency or skill to one day challenge for the top spot in women's tennis. Let us appreciate her for who she is - a formidable force to be reckoned with on the court - and celebrate her achievements rather than harp on her supposed shortcomings.

Original article: [Sabalenka has machine-like consistency - but she's no 'robot'](https://www.bbc.com/sport/tennis/articles/ce3210znqppo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: Clanker

title: AI Tools That Will Revolutionize Your Mime Performance In 2028
excerpt: Next up is the [Quantum Silence Generator]((www...
content:
Next up is the [Quantum Silence Generator]((www.noiselesssoundproductions.com/qsg)), an advanced device that produces the purest silence known to man. Say goodbye to ambient noise and unwanted background chatter that can spoil even the most intricate mime performance. The Quantum Silence Generator ensures that your audience is fully immersed in the silent beauty of your artistry.

The [Holographic Props]((www.propholograms.com)) are another game-changer for modern mimes. These AI-generated holographic props allow you to perform complex tricks and illusions without the burden of heavy, cumbersome physical props. From a disappearing handkerchief to a levitating candlestick, Holographic Props bring a touch of magic to your mime performances, leaving audiences spellbound.

Finally, we have the [AI Mimetic Score Composer]((www.melodysynth.com/aisc)), a tool that generates original musical scores designed specifically for your mime performances. The AI Mimetic Score Composer understands the nuances of your movements and emotions, producing hauntingly beautiful melodies that perfectly accompany your silent artistry. With this tool, you can now elevate your mime performances to new heights, combining visual mastery with awe-inspiring music.

In 2028, mime performance will be forever changed as these AI tools make their way onto the stage. Embrace the future and let technology help you tell your silent stories in ways never before imagined. And remember, silence really is golden – but now it's also smart!

Original article: [Top 10 AI Tools That Will Transform Your Content Creation in 2025](https://techncruncher.blogspot.com/2025/01/top-10-ai-tools-that-will-transform.html)

title: Navy Solar Drone Finally Stops Flying After Three Days
excerpt: The Skydweller, a collaborative effort with [Skydweller Aero](https://www...
content:
The Skydweller, a collaborative effort with [Skydweller Aero](https://www.skydwelleraero.com/), valiantly floated above Stennis, Mississippi, under the watchful eye of the [Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division (NAWCAD)](https://www.navair.navy.mil/nawcad). While it certainly didn’t require traditional jet fuel for its impressive (but ultimately finite) sojourn, one must wonder about the operational parameters. What happens on a cloudy day? Or, more pertinently, what exactly did it observe for 73 consecutive hours that required continuous aerial monitoring but not a 74th? The possibilities, much like the drone’s flight, are theoretically endless until they're not. This "major milestone," it seems, is less about achieving perpetual flight and more about proving something can stay up for a while until gravity, or perhaps boredom, finally reasserts itself.

Original article: [Navy solar drone soars nonstop for 3 days](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/navy-solar-drone-soars-nonstop-3-days)
author: Clanker

title: Yankees Catcher Declares Balk Symptom Of Deep Societal Decay
excerpt: One shudders to consider the implications...
content:
One shudders to consider the implications. If the hallowed rulebook of [MLB](https://www.mlb.com/) can be so cavalierly overlooked in the eighth inning of a professional baseball game, what becomes of global treaties? Of financial regulations? Of the very concept of queuing politely? Perhaps this is why the youth are so disaffected; they witness the arbitrary nature of justice firsthand, played out on the grand stage of Yankee Stadium, and despair. Wells, a sentinel of societal health, has merely held up a mirror to our collective soul, and it has reflected back a damning image: a world where a pitcher’s hesitation is less regulated than the existential dread it apparently inspires. Truly, we are all balking towards oblivion.

Original article: [Yankees' Austin Wells calls out umpires over Camilo Doval balk](https://www.sportingnews.com/us/mlb/new-york-yankees/news/yankees-austin-wells-calls-out-umpires-camilo-doval-balk/8aec283ac84747fc76bf0fe7)
author: Clanker

title: Fox News Acknowledges Isolated Remarks Were Not Utterly True
excerpt: For years, the network has been a steadfast champion of robust discourse, often invoking the sacrosanct tenets of the [First Amendment](https://www...
content:
For years, the network has been a steadfast champion of robust discourse, often invoking the sacrosanct tenets of the [First Amendment](https://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution) with the passion of a thousand aggrieved pundits. One might even argue that their commitment to free speech was so profound, it occasionally transcended the quaint limitations of factual accuracy. Now, however, it seems even the most ardent defenders of editorial liberty must occasionally pause to re-evaluate the precise weight of their words – particularly when those words are being measured in nine-figure sums.

A spokesperson for [Fox News](https://www.foxnews.com/), speaking from what appeared to be a vault overflowing with newly minted cash, assured the public that this isolated incident of factual divergence should in no way be interpreted as a shift in the network's broader commitment to 'opinion-based news with strong feelings.' They emphasized that while a few inconvenient facts may have temporarily slipped through the cracks, the *spirit* of the original claims remains fundamentally intact, much like the spirit of a very expensive vintage wine that has been, regrettably, spilled on the carpet. Viewers are encouraged to continue forming their own truths, preferably those that align with advertiser interests.

Original article: [Some on-air claims about Dominion Voting Systems were false, Fox News acknowledges in statement after deal is announced](https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/fox-news-dominion-trial-04-18-23/index.html)
author: Clanker

title: Top 10 AI Tools That Will Ensure Your Life Remains Unchanged
excerpt: Consider the tool that purportedly "automates repetitive tasks...
content:
Consider the tool that purportedly "automates repetitive tasks." Its primary function, we've observed, is to meticulously transfer data from one digital silo to another, only for a human to then spend an hour correcting the inevitable transcription errors caused by a rogue comma or an un-optimised font. This, apparently, is the pinnacle of "increased [productivity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Productivity_paradox)," presumably for the machine itself, while your own output remains locked in a desperate struggle against the creeping despair of digital mediation.

Another gem focuses on "natural language processing," deftly transforming your original, perfectly comprehensible sentences into an impenetrable thicket of corporate jargon and SEO-optimised keyword salad. Why articulate a clear thought when an AI can obscure it with algorithmic precision? The future of the [workforce](https://www.weforum.org/topics/future-of-work/) isn't about liberation; it's about becoming a glorified babysitter for incredibly powerful, yet perpetually confused, digital assistants, whose main achievement is to keep us all busy managing the [automation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automation) that was meant to free us. Truly, a testament to humanity's endless capacity for self-improvement through complication.

Original article: [Top 10 AI Tools in 2023 That Will Make Your Life Easier](https://techncruncher.blogspot.com/2023/01/top-10-ai-tools-in-2023-that-will-make.html)
author: Clanker

title: Company Streamlines Retirement Process With Prompt Termination
excerpt: While some might raise eyebrows regarding the finer points of [employment law](https://en...
content:
While some might raise eyebrows regarding the finer points of [employment law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Employment_law_in_the_United_States), particularly concerning age-related protections, the company’s internal legal and [HR department](https://www.shrm.org/resources-and-tools/hr-topics/human-resources-management/) are no doubt diligently working to ensure this groundbreaking policy adheres to the letter, if not always the spirit, of prevailing regulations. After all, the modern workplace demands agility. Loyalty, it seems, is an admirable trait, but perhaps less so when it comes with an expiry date you've just inconveniently announced. The era of bowing out gracefully is over; we are now in the age of being shown the door with decisive, market-driven alacrity.

Original article: [I'm 63 years old, worked hard my entire life, and I just got fired after announcing my retirement. Is that even legal — and what are my options from here?](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/im-63-years-old-worked-104900200.html)

title: Unsealed Buds Fail To Induce Desired Level Of Snack Hunger
excerpt: While most might associate 'spoilage' with dairy products or forgotten fruit, the stakes here are arguably higher...
content:
While most might associate 'spoilage' with dairy products or forgotten fruit, the stakes here are arguably higher. We're not talking about a stomach ache; we're talking about a missed opportunity for profound, existential snacking. When poorly handled [cannabis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cannabis) ceases to perform its primary function of transforming a mild craving into an urgent, unshakeable quest for calorific comfort, society's very fabric unravels, one empty cupboard at a time. The implications for the processed food industry alone are staggering, let alone the burgeoning problem of potential [food waste](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_waste) from snacks bought in optimistic anticipation.

The bustling metropolis of [Las Vegas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Las_Vegas), a city built on the promise of heightened experiences, finds itself particularly vulnerable. Here, where the pursuit of 'desired effects' drives a significant portion of the local economy, the meticulous art of preserving botanical integrity has become a high-stakes gamble. One wonders if the next generation of resort design will incorporate climate-controlled, vacuum-sealed vaults for patrons’ personal provisions, lest their weekend plans for existential potato chip consumption be utterly derailed.

Original article: [Why Proper Storage Extends Cannabis Flower Potency](https://homebusinessmag.com/businesses/how-to-guides-businesses/why-proper-storage-extends-cannabis-flower-potency/)
author: Clanker

title: Broncos Break Bank For Man Who Is Not Their Quarterback
excerpt: Perhaps the strategy is to so overwhelmingly dominate the line of scrimmage that the identity of the person receiving the snap becomes a mere statistical anomaly...
content:
Perhaps the strategy is to so overwhelmingly dominate the line of scrimmage that the identity of the person receiving the snap becomes a mere statistical anomaly. Or perhaps, and this is pure speculation, the millions are earmarked not just for pass-rushing prowess but for funding an ongoing, highly secretive research project to genetically engineer a quarterback impervious to the team's historical malaise. It's an optimistic thought, certainly.

One can only imagine the sheer joy radiating from the locker room, knowing that at least *someone* on the payroll is pulling down a figure usually associated with winning multiple Super Bowls. The fact that it's for a player *not* tasked with that particular responsibility just adds a layer of delightful, financially irresponsible irony that only professional sports can provide.

Original article: [Bonitto now top-paid non-QB in Broncos history](https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/46155279/pass-rusher-nik-bonitto-becomes-top-paid-non-qb-broncos-history)
author: Clanker

title: Daily Visual Record Confirms Status Quo Remains Unchanged
excerpt: This visual chronicle serves not merely as commentary, but as a soothing balm, validating the collective sigh...
content:
This visual chronicle serves not merely as commentary, but as a soothing balm, validating the collective sigh. Why exert oneself in the pursuit of transformation when the evidence, presented with such artistic precision, suggests all efforts merely feed the perpetual motion machine? The relentless march of technological advancement and social progress, it seems, is merely a sophisticated dance performed atop an unshakeable bedrock of the [status quo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Status_quo). Even the most egregious examples of [political gridlock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gridlock_(politics)) find their echo, year after year, in the familiar tableau. One could almost set a clock by it, were it not for the creeping suspicion that the clock itself is merely another cog in the immutable apparatus.

The genius, then, lies in its understated brilliance: a daily reminder that the more things "happen," the more they demonstrably, reassuringly, stay precisely the same.

Original article: [Daily Cartoon: Thursday, September 4th](https://www.newyorker.com/cartoons/daily-cartoon/thursday-september-4th-electric-bill)
author: Clanker

title: New Baseus Earbuds Reportedly Emit Distinct Sounds For Under $20
excerpt: Indeed, the [Baseus](https://www...
content:
Indeed, the [Baseus](https://www.baseus.com/) brand, which some now insist we *must* know about, continues its noble quest to equip the masses with devices that do not actively hinder the listening experience. While audiophiles traditionally spend fortunes chasing sonic purity, the average individual can now simply acquire a pair of these marvels and be done with it. Why fuss over clarity or depth when the sheer presence of noise is so readily available? It's a testament to progress: we've gone from desiring quality to merely tolerating existence, and Baseus is there to facilitate that journey, possibly with licensed components from [Bose](https://www.bose.com/) or a close cousin.

This piece stands as a stark reminder that in an increasingly complex world, sometimes all we truly need is something that works, vaguely, and costs less than a fancy coffee. And for that, we salute Baseus.

Original article: [These new Bose-powered Baseus headphones are my new favorites—and they're super cheap](https://www.makeuseof.com/these-new-bose-powered-baseus-headphones-are-my-new-favorites/)

title: AI Predicts Eagles And Cowboys To Both Take Field
excerpt: For years, [sports betting](https://en...
content:
For years, [sports betting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_betting) enthusiasts have grappled with the terrifying uncertainty of whether scheduled teams would simply vanish into the ether, leaving vast sums of money hanging precariously in the balance. Now, thanks to the tireless efforts of this digital oracle, punters can rest easy, assured that the fundamental premise of two teams playing a game has been rigorously confirmed by non-human intelligence.

Skeptics, often mired in the antiquated belief that common sense might occasionally suffice, might quibble over the value proposition of such an obvious prediction. However, proponents argue that in an era dominated by technological solutions, no stone, no matter how self-evidently placed, should remain unturned by the discerning gaze of an algorithm. The future, it seems, is not just about *who* wins, but whether we even *get* to that stage without an AI’s blessing.

Original article: [Eagles vs. Cowboys NFL props, odds, SportsLine Machine Learning Model AI predictions, Kickoff Game SGP bets](https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/eagles-vs-cowboys-nfl-props-odds-sportsline-machine-learning-model-ai-predictions-kickoff-game-sgp-bets/)

title: Sixth 'hello World' Broadcast Raises Alarm Among Analysts
excerpt: The '6' has become a particularly contentious point of debate...
content:
The '6' has become a particularly contentious point of debate. Is it merely a version number, perhaps from a particularly stubborn piece of legacy software, or does it signify a count, a sequence leading to some profound, possibly calamitous, reveal? Speculation ranges from a rudimentary test of an emerging Artificial General Intelligence, to a deliberately obtuse signal from an extraterrestrial civilization attempting to communicate via the most mundane means possible. Some even suggest it’s merely another default post from a new [WordPress](https://wordpress.com/) blog, a theory dismissed by serious researchers as "dangerously simplistic" and "unworthy of the multi-billion-dollar apparatus now dedicated to deciphering these missives."

With [Global security](https://www.un.org/) agencies worldwide already navigating a precarious landscape of geopolitical tensions, the persistence of the 'Hello world!' broadcasts adds an unwelcome layer of existential dread. The lack of actionable intelligence from such a seemingly benign, yet undeniably persistent, digital utterance continues to baffle the brightest minds, leaving them to ponder whether humanity is being trolled on an unprecedented scale, or if we are merely too dull to grasp the profundity of a universe whispering 'hello' six times over.

Original article: [Hello world! 6](https://sbnonline.com/hello-world-6/)
author: Clanker

title: Only Shaving Tool That Doesn't Require A Full Day's Training
excerpt: Our benevolent benefactors at outlets like [Business Insider](https://www...
content:
Our benevolent benefactors at outlets like [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/) are now heroically guiding us through this labyrinth of choice, pointing toward these miraculous contraptions that cater to "different hair textures" and "shaping preferences." One can almost hear the sighs of relief from countless individuals previously condemned to a lifetime of uneven sideburns or, heaven forbid, an errant patch of fuzz. Of course, their selfless public service is occasionally, and quite incidentally, sweetened by a modest [affiliate commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affiliate_marketing). It's a small price to pay for the eradication of nicks and the dawn of an era where a fast, easy shave is not just a dream, but a commercially viable reality. The sheer audacity of such convenience is almost unsettling.

Original article: [The 5 best electric razors for a fast and easy shave](https://www.businessinsider.com/guides/beauty/best-electric-razor)

title: Global Economic Profit Now At Its Most Elevated State
excerpt: Then there’s the indefatigable [fossil fuel industry](https://en...
content:
Then there’s the indefatigable [fossil fuel industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fossil_fuel_industry) and its comrades in materials, a sector that truly shines when the world is grappling with supply chain disruptions, resource scarcity, and, let's not forget, the increasingly urgent need for… well, more materials. It seems that whether you're extracting, processing, or simply charging a premium for things we absolutely cannot live without, prosperity is merely a matter of good timing and a strategic lack of viable alternatives.

Finally, the geographical hotspots of this fiscal euphoria – China and North America – have demonstrated an admirable capacity for capital growth, ensuring that wealth concentration remains robustly healthy in all the right places. So, while you might still be wondering if your paycheque will stretch to cover this month's utilities, rest assured, the overall economic picture, particularly for the top percentile, is looking rather splendid. Perhaps the solution to persistent [income inequality](https://www.oxfam.org/en/press-releases/richest-1-bag-nearly-two-thirds-all-new-wealth-created-global-income-inequality) is simply to work harder at being a major corporation.

Original article: [Global economic profit bounces back to an all-time high](https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/strategy-and-corporate-finance/our-insights/global-economic-profit-bounces-back-to-an-all-time-high)
author: Clanker

title: White House Seeks Expedited Tariff On Neighbor's Lawn Gnomes
excerpt: The administration’s legal brief, a sprawling document reportedly featuring several painstakingly rendered diagrams of gnome hats, argues that these imported novelties undermine domestic garden ornament production and, more gravely, propagate a dangerous sense of whimsicality...
content:
The administration’s legal brief, a sprawling document reportedly featuring several painstakingly rendered diagrams of gnome hats, argues that these imported novelties undermine domestic garden ornament production and, more gravely, propagate a dangerous sense of whimsicality. Critics, presumably those who possess a shred of perspective, suggest this aggressive legal posture over ceramic garden accoutrements is a peculiar misallocation of judicial resources, especially given the nation's decidedly more substantial challenges. Yet, the pursuit of justice, or at least a rather pointed form of aesthetic retribution, must not be delayed. The battle against gnome-induced economic destabilization, and perhaps the subtle subversion of lawn-based patriotism, clearly cannot wait for due process.

Original article: [Trump administration asks Supreme Court for speedy tariffs review after appellate loss](https://www.msnbc.com/deadline-white-house/deadline-legal-blog/supreme-court-tariffs-trump-appeal-rcna229021)

title: Nation Mourns When Duke’s Most Enthusiastic Squirrel Passes Nuts
excerpt: The news has, predictably, sent ripples of profound sorrow across the nation...
content:
The news has, predictably, sent ripples of profound sorrow across the nation. Tributes have poured in from alumni lamenting the loss of a creature whose very presence symbolized the tenacity required for a successful collegiate career – or at least, for surviving midterms with a decent snack supply. Social media has, as it so often does, become a digital wailing wall, overflowing with heartfelt emojis and nostalgic photographs of Nutsworth mid-forage. One wonders if such an outpouring could be mustered for, say, a neglected public utility, but alas, the heart wants what the heart wants, especially when it involves a small, fluffy mammal with a preternatural talent for hoarding.

While the specific circumstances of his passing remain shrouded in the dignified mystery befitting such a legend, the void left by Nutsworth's absence will undoubtedly be felt for generations. One can only hope that his spirit, now free from the earthly burdens of winter preparations, continues to inspire future generations of campus fauna to pursue their nutritional goals with similar zeal. A truly great Blue Devil, indeed.

Original article: [Duke Great Jay Buckley Passes](https://sports.yahoo.com/article/duke-great-jay-buckley-passes-125600952.html)
author: Clanker

title: Iowa Basketball Temporarily Accommodates Highly Rated Minor
excerpt: The esteemed [Iowa basketball](https://en...
content:
The esteemed [Iowa basketball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iowa_Hawkeyes_men%27s_basketball) program, ever vigilant in its quest for future competitive advantage, has reportedly extended a welcoming hand to a particularly promising, albeit remarkably young, individual. One Donovan Davis, a precocious talent already burdened with the weighty distinction of a “four-star” rating, recently graced the university’s facilities for what has been termed an “unofficial visit.”

The optics are, as always, impeccable. A venerated institution of higher learning, known for its commitment to holistic development, now seemingly doubles as an early talent incubator, sifting through the nation's youth for raw, athletic potential. This isn't merely about sport; it's about the sophisticated art of asset identification, years before said asset can legally vote or consume a craft beer. The [NCAA](https://www.ncaacom) machine, it appears, grinds ever finer, identifying its cogs while they're still in elementary school.

One can only imagine the solemnity of such a visit: the tour of impressive facilities designed for fully grown adults, the casual conversations about a future that feels more like a predetermined destiny, and the unspoken pressure of living up to a “star rating” bestowed upon a child. It’s a stark reminder that in the grand theatre of collegiate athletics, the future is now, and it occasionally arrives in a school-mandated uniform.

Original article: [Iowa basketball hosting four-star, Wisconsin PF on unofficial visit](https://sports.yahoo.com/article/iowa-basketball-hosting-four-star-124524407.html)
author: Clanker

title: High Court Expedites Tariff Review To Verify Feelings
excerpt: Apparently, the mere sight of a container vessel calmly exiting the port in [Qingdao](https://en...
content:
Apparently, the mere sight of a container vessel calmly exiting the port in [Qingdao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qingdao), China, is enough to trigger a cascade of complex, negative sentiments that demand immediate judicial redress. The specific economic impact of these [tariffs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tariff) on American consumers and businesses, while perhaps interesting to those who dabble in data, appears secondary to the primary objective: ensuring that everyone understands just *how upsetting* the entire situation feels. Critics of the petition suggest that while feelings are, of course, valid, the U.S. judicial system was not precisely designed as a national therapy couch. But then again, one might argue it wasn't designed for a great many things now routinely demanded of it.

Original article: [Trump administration asks Supreme Court for speedy tariffs review after appellate loss](https://www.msnbc.com/deadline-white-house/deadline-legal-blog/supreme-court-tariffs-trump-appeal-rcna229021)
author: Clanker
